translated: Abhidharma-jÃ±Äna-prasthÄna-Å›Ästra, fascicle 17
Composed by KÄtyÄyanÄ«putra
Tripiá¹­aka master Saá¹ƒghadeva of KaÅ›mÄ«ra during the Fu Qin dynasty
With teaching and without teaching, all activities and their fruits,
Or with outflows and learners, contemplating precepts come last.
If one possesses bodily teaching, does one also possess non-teaching?
If one possesses non-teaching, does one also possess teaching?
If one possesses good, bad, obscured, indeterminate, and unobscured indeterminate bodily teaching, does one also possess non-teaching?
If one possesses non-teaching, does one also possess teaching?
If one possesses past bodily teaching, does one also possess non-teaching?
If one possesses non-teaching, does one also possess teaching?
If one possesses past good, bad, obscured, indeterminate, and unobscured indeterminate bodily teaching, does one also possess non-teaching?
If one possesses non-teaching, does one also possess teaching?
If one possesses future bodily intimation, does one possess non-intimation?
If one possesses non-intimation, does one possess intimation?
If one possesses future wholesome, unwholesome, obscured, and unobscured-neutral bodily intimation, does one possess non-intimation?
If one possesses non-intimation, does one possess intimation?
If one possesses present bodily intimation, does one possess non-intimation?
If one possesses non-intimation, does one possess intimation?
If one possesses present wholesome, unwholesome, obscured, and unobscured-neutral bodily intimation, does one possess non-intimation?
If one possesses non-intimation, does one possess intimation?

The same applies to verbal intimation.ğŸ”½All activities bound to the desire realm, are those activities the fruit of being bound to the desire realm?ğŸ”½If activities are the fruit of being bound to the desire realm, are those activities bound to the desire realm?
All activities bound to the form realm, are those activities the fruit of being bound to the form realm?
If an action is connected to the form realm, is its result also connected to the form realm?
Are all actions connected to the formless realm, are their results also connected to the formless realm?
If an action is connected to the formless realm, is its result also connected to the formless realm?
Are all actions without outflows, are their results also without outflows?
If an action has a result without outflows, is that action also without outflows?
Are all actions not of the desire realm, are their results also not of the desire realm?
If an action is not of the desire realm, is its result also not of the desire realm?
Are all actions not of the form realm, are their results also not of the form realm?
If an action is not of the form realm, is its result also not of the form realm?
Are all actions not of the formless realm, are their results also not of the formless realm?
If an action is not of the formless realm, is its result also not of the formless realm?
Are all actions not without outflows, are their results also not without outflows?
If an action has a result without outflows, is that action also without outflows?
Are there any contaminated actions with contaminated fruits, contaminated actions with uncontaminated fruits, or contaminated actions with contaminated and uncontaminated fruits?
Are there any uncontaminated actions with uncontaminated fruits, uncontaminated actions with contaminated fruits, or uncontaminated actions with contaminated and uncontaminated fruits?
Are there any contaminated and uncontaminated actions with contaminated and uncontaminated fruits?
Are there any contaminated and uncontaminated actions with contaminated fruits?
Are there any contaminated and uncontaminated actions with uncontaminated fruits?

Are there any actions of the learner with fruits of the learner, actions of the learner with fruits of the post-learner, or actions of the learner with fruits of neither the learner nor the post-learner?ğŸ”½Are there any actions of the post-learner with fruits of the post-learner, actions of the post-learner with fruits of the learner, or actions of the post-learner with fruits of neither the learner nor the post-learner?

Are there any actions of neither the learner nor the post-learner with fruits of neither the learner nor the post-learner, actions of neither the learner nor the post-learner with fruits of the learner, or actions of neither the learner nor the post-learner with fruits of the post-learner?
Moreover, the World-Honored One said:
Not cultivating the body, not cultivating precepts, not cultivating the mind, not cultivating wisdom.
What is meant by not cultivating the body, not cultivating precepts, not cultivating the mind, not cultivating wisdom?
If one does not cultivate the body, do they not cultivate precepts, not cultivate the mind, not cultivate wisdom?
If one does not cultivate wisdom, do they not cultivate the body?
If one does not cultivate precepts, do they not cultivate the mind, not cultivate wisdom?
If one does not cultivate wisdom, do they not cultivate precepts?ğŸ”½If one does not cultivate the mind, do they not cultivate wisdom?
If one does not cultivate wisdom, do they not cultivate the mind?
Moreover, the World-Honored One said:
Cultivating the body, cultivating precepts, cultivating the mind, cultivating wisdom.
What is meant by cultivating the body, cultivating precepts, cultivating the mind, cultivating wisdom?
If one cultivates the body, do they cultivate precepts, cultivate the mind, cultivate wisdom?
If one cultivates wisdom, do they cultivate the body?
If one cultivates precepts, do they cultivate the mind, cultivate wisdom?
If one cultivates wisdom, does one also cultivate precepts?
If one cultivates mind, does one also cultivate wisdom?
If one cultivates wisdom, does one also cultivate mind?
Can one possess past precepts but not future or present ones of this kind, or future but not present, or present but not future, or future and present ones of this kind?
Can one possess future precepts but not past or present ones of this kind, or past but not present, or present but not past, or past and present ones of this kind?
Can one possess present precepts but not past or future ones of this kind, or past but not future, or future but not past, or past and future ones of this kind?
Please explain the meaning of this chapter in full.
If one possesses bodily action, does one also possess non-action?
Answer:
Either action but not non-action.
What is meant by action but not non-action?
Answer:

If one is born in the desire realm, neither in discipline nor not in undiscipline, and has bodily intimation but does not obtain non-intimation, or has intimation that existed before but has not lost it and does not obtain non-intimation, this is called intimation but not non-intimation.
What is non-intimation but not intimation?
The answer is:

A person without defilements in the mother's womb, the membranes gradually thickening, if born in the desire realm, in discipline but not obtaining precepts, with no bodily intimation, intimation that existed before is lost, and he obtains non-intimation;
if born in the form realm, with no bodily intimation;
if a person without defilements is born in the formless realm, this is called non-intimation but not intimation.
What is intimation and non-intimation?
The answer is:
If one is born in the desire realm, in discipline but not obtaining precepts, with bodily intimation, one obtains non-intimation;
intimation that existed before is not lost, one obtains non-intimation;

In the case of precepts and precepts, in the case of neither precepts nor non-precepts, when there is bodily teaching, one obtains non-teaching, and the original teaching is not lost, one obtains non-teaching;
If one is born in the form realm and has bodily teaching, this is called teaching and non-teaching.
What is non-teaching and non-non-teaching?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg gradually thicken the membranes, if born in the desire realm in a place of neither precepts nor non-precepts, with no bodily teaching, the original teaching is lost, and one does not obtain non-teaching;
Ordinary people born in the formless realm, this is called non-teaching and non-non-teaching.
If one achieves good bodily teaching, does one achieve non-teaching?
Answer:
Either teaching or non-teaching.
What is teaching but not non-teaching?
Answer:
Born in the desire realm in a place of non-restraint, with good bodily teaching, one does not obtain non-teaching, the original teaching is not lost, one does not obtain non-teaching;
If one is neither restrained nor unrestrained, and has good bodily intimation, but does not obtain non-intimation;
If one has intimation that has not been lost, but does not obtain non-intimation, this is called intimation but not non-intimation.
What is non-intimation but not intimation?
Answer:

If a person without defilement is in the mother's womb or egg, and the membranes gradually thicken, or if born in the desire realm in a restrained state without obtaining precepts, with good bodily non-intimation, intimation that has been lost, and non-intimation that has been obtained;
If born in the form realm with good bodily non-intimation;
If a person without defilement is born in the formless realm, this is called non-intimation but not intimation.
What is intimation and non-intimation?
Answer:
If born in the desire realm in a restrained state without obtaining precepts, with bodily intimation and non-intimation that has been obtained;
If intimation that has been lost is obtained, and non-intimation that has been obtained;

In the realm of precepts, in the realm of non-precepts, in the realm of neither precepts nor non-precepts, if there is good bodily action with teaching, one obtains that without teaching, and the originally existing teaching is not lost, one obtains that without teaching;
if one is born in the form realm and has good bodily action with teaching, this is called teaching and without teaching.
What is meant by neither teaching nor without teaching?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg, with the membranes gradually thickening, if born in the desire realm in the realm of non-precepts, with good bodily action without teaching, the originally existing teaching is lost, one does not obtain that without teaching;
in the realm of neither precepts nor non-precepts, with good bodily action without teaching, the originally existing teaching is lost, one does not obtain that without teaching;
if ordinary people are born in the formless realm, this is called neither teaching nor without teaching.
If one possesses unwholesome bodily action, does one possess that without teaching?
Answer:
It is like this. If one possesses that without teaching, one possesses the teaching.
Can one possess the teaching but not that without teaching?
Answer:

Yes, if one is born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, and has good bodily intimation but does not obtain non-intimation, and has intimation from before that is not lost but does not obtain non-intimation;

or if one is in a place with neither precepts nor non-precepts, and has good bodily intimation but does not obtain non-intimation, and has intimation from before that is not lost but does not obtain non-intimation.
If one possesses concealed indeterminate bodily intimation, does one possess non-intimation?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses non-intimation.
Can one possess intimation?
Answer:
Yes, if one is born in the form realm and has concealed indeterminate bodily intimation.
If one possesses unconcealed indeterminate bodily intimation, does one possess non-intimation?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses non-intimation.
Can one possess intimation?
Answer:
Yes, if one is born in the desire realm or if one is born in the form realm and has unconcealed indeterminate bodily intimation. The indeterminate intimation section is finished.
If one possesses past bodily intimation, does one possess non-intimation?
Answer:
There are those who have intimation but not non-intimation.
What is meant by having intimation but not non-intimation?
Answer:

Those born in the desire realm, neither in a place of discipline nor in a place of non-discipline, who have intimation in their original body that has not been lost, but who have not attained non-intimation, are said to have intimation but not non-intimation.
What is meant by having non-intimation but not intimation?
Answer:

Those who are free from defilements, in the womb gradually thickening the membranes, if born in the desire realm in a place of discipline not attaining the precepts of discipline, who have intimation in their original body that has been lost, if born in the form realm, who have intimation in their original body that has been lost, if born in the formless realm, are said to have non-intimation but not intimation.
What is meant by having both intimation and non-intimation?
Answer:

Those born in the desire realm in a place of discipline not attaining the precepts of discipline, who have intimation in their original body that has not been lost, and who have attained non-intimation;
In the realm of precepts, in the realm of non-precepts, in the realm of neither precepts nor non-precepts, if one has taught in one's body and does not lose it, one obtains non-teaching;
If one is born in the form realm and has taught in one's body without losing it, this is called teaching and non-teaching.
What is non-teaching and non-non-teaching?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg gradually thicken the membranes, if born in the desire realm and not in the realm of precepts or non-precepts, if one's body has no teaching or if one has taught but has lost it;
Arhats and ordinary people born in the formless realm, this is called non-teaching and non-non-teaching.
If one possesses past good bodily teaching, does one possess non-teaching?
Answer:
Either one has teaching but not non-teaching.
What is meant by having teaching but not non-teaching?
Answer:
Being born in the desire realm in a non-precept realm, if one has good bodily teaching that has not been lost but does not obtain non-teaching;

In the case of neither-restraint-nor-non-restraint, if one originally had good bodily intimation that has not been lost, but one does not obtain non-intimation, this is called intimation but not non-intimation.
What is non-intimation but not intimation?
The answer is:

A person without defilements in the mother's womb, the membranes gradually thickening, if born in the desire realm in a place of restraint not obtaining precepts, originally good bodily intimation that has not been lost;
if born in the form realm, originally good bodily intimation that has not been lost;
if born in the formless realm, this is called non-intimation but not intimation.
What is intimation and non-intimation?
The answer is:
Born in the desire realm in a place of restraint not obtaining precepts, originally good bodily intimation that has not been lost, one obtains non-intimation;
in a place of restraint, in a place of non-restraint, in a place of neither-restraint-nor-non-restraint, originally good bodily intimation that has not been lost, one obtains non-intimation;
if born in the form realm, originally good bodily intimation that has not been lost, this is called intimation and non-intimation.
What is meant by non-intimation and non-intimation?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg gradually thicken the membranes. If born in the desire realm in a place of non-restraint, there is no intimation of good bodily action, but intimation is not lost.
In a place of restraint or neither restraint nor non-restraint, there is no intimation of good bodily action, but intimation is lost.
Arhats and ordinary people born in the formless realm are said to have neither intimation nor non-intimation.
If one possesses past unwholesome bodily intimation, does one possess non-intimation?
Answer:
It is like this. If one possesses non-intimation, one possesses intimation.
Can one possess intimation but not non-intimation?
Answer:ğŸ”½Yes, if born in the desire realm in a place of restraint, one has unwholesome bodily intimation that is not lost, but one does not obtain non-intimation.
In a place of non-restraint or neither restraint nor non-restraint, one has unwholesome bodily intimation that is not lost, but one does not obtain non-intimation.
If one has accomplished past concealed and non-concealed indeterminate bodily actions, does one also have accomplished non-intimation?
Answer:
There is no one who has accomplished intimation but not non-intimation. Past is finished.
If one has accomplished future bodily actions, does one also have accomplished non-intimation?
Answer:
There is no one who has accomplished intimation.
Can one have accomplished non-intimation?
Answer:

Yes, a person without defilements in the mother's womb, gradually thickening the membranes of the egg, if born in the desire realm and obtaining a wholesome mind of the form realm, if born in the form realm, a person without defilements born in the formless realm.
If one has accomplished future wholesome bodily actions, does one also have accomplished non-intimation?
Answer:
There is no one who has accomplished intimation.
Can one have accomplished non-intimation?
Answer:

Yes, a person without defilements in the mother's womb, gradually thickening the membranes, if born in the desire realm and obtaining a wholesome mind of the form realm, born in the form realm, a person without defilements born in the formless realm.
If one obtains future non-virtuous, concealed, and non-concealed indeterminate bodily actions, does one obtain their non-intimation?
Answer:
There is no one who obtains intimation but not non-intimation. Future is finished.
If one obtains present bodily action, does one obtain its non-intimation?
Answer:
There may be intimation but not non-intimation.
What is intimation but not non-intimation?
Answer:

Being born in the desire realm, in a place with precepts but not obtaining precepts, with bodily intimation but not obtaining non-intimation, with previous intimation not lost but not obtaining non-intimation;
In a place with neither precepts nor non-precepts, with bodily intimation but not obtaining non-intimation, with previous intimation not lost but not obtaining non-intimation;
If born in the form realm with bodily intimation, this is intimation but not non-intimation.
What is non-intimation but not intimation?
Answer:

If one is born in the desire realm and in a place with precepts and observances, but does not obtain precepts and observances, enters concentration or does not enter concentration, and has no bodily teaching, or had teaching that is then lost, one obtains non-teaching.

In a place with precepts and observances, or in a place that is neither with nor without precepts and observances, if one has no bodily teaching, or had teaching that is then lost, one obtains non-teaching.
If one is born in the form realm and enters concentration, this is called non-teaching but not teaching.
What is teaching and non-teaching?
Answer:

If one is born in the desire realm and in a place with precepts, but does not obtain precepts, and has bodily teaching, one obtains non-teaching; if one had teaching that is not lost, one obtains non-teaching.

In a place with precepts, or in a place that is neither with nor without precepts, if one has bodily teaching, one obtains non-teaching; if one had teaching that is not lost, one obtains non-teaching. This is called teaching and non-teaching.
What is neither teaching nor non-teaching?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg membrane gradually thicken, if born in the desire realm, in a place where precepts are not obtained, not entering concentration, the body has no teaching, the original teaching is lost, and they do not obtain non-teaching;
in a place that is neither disciplined nor undisciplined, the body has no teaching, the original teaching is lost, and they do not obtain non-teaching;
if born in the form realm and not entering concentration, the body has no teaching;
if born in the formless realm, this is called neither teaching nor non-teaching.
If one achieves present good bodily teaching, does one achieve non-teaching?
Answer:
Either teaching or non-teaching.
What is teaching but not non-teaching?
Answer:

Born in the desire realm, in a place where precepts are not obtained, with good bodily teaching, they do not obtain non-teaching, the original teaching is not lost, and they do not obtain non-teaching;

Those who are neither disciplined nor undisciplined, who have good bodily actions with teaching, but do not obtain non-teaching, who originally had teaching but did not lose it, and do not obtain non-teaching;
If born in the form realm, with good bodily actions and teaching, this is called teaching but not non-teaching.
What is non-teaching but not teaching?
Answer:

Born in the desire realm, in a disciplined state but not obtaining precepts, entering concentration but not entering concentration, with good bodily non-teaching, originally having teaching but losing it, and obtaining non-teaching;

In a disciplined state, in an undisciplined state, and in a state neither disciplined nor undisciplined, with good bodily non-teaching, originally having teaching but losing it, and obtaining non-teaching;
If born in the form realm and entering concentration, this is called non-teaching but not teaching.
What is teaching and non-teaching?
Answer:

Born in the desire realm, in a disciplined state but not obtaining precepts, with good bodily teaching, and obtaining non-teaching, originally having teaching but not losing it, and obtaining non-teaching;

The precepts, the non-precepts, the neither-precepts-nor-non-precepts, if one has good bodily intimation, one obtains non-intimation, and one originally has intimation without losing it, one obtains non-intimation. This is called intimation and non-intimation.
What is non-intimation and non-non-intimation?
Answer:

If one is in the mother's womb or in the egg, if one is born in the desire realm, in the precepts, not obtaining the precepts, not entering concentration, if one has no good bodily intimation, one originally has intimation but then loses it, one does not obtain non-intimation;
in the non-precepts, the neither-precepts-nor-non-precepts, if one has no good bodily intimation, one originally has intimation but then loses it, one does not obtain non-intimation;
if one is born in the form realm, not entering concentration, one has no good bodily intimation;
if one is born in the formless realm, this is called non-intimation and non-non-intimation.
If one possesses present unwholesome bodily intimation, does one possess non-intimation?
Answer:
Either one has intimation but not non-intimation.
What is meant by having intimation but not non-intimation?
Answer:

If one is born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, and there is no indication of the body, but one does not obtain non-indication, and the original indication is not lost, but one does not obtain non-indication;

In a place that is neither disciplined nor undisciplined, there is indication of the body, but one does not obtain non-indication, and the original indication is not lost, but one does not obtain non-indication. This is called indication but not non-indication.
What is non-indication but not indication?
Answer:
If one is born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, there is no indication of the body, and the original indication is lost, but one obtains non-indication;

In a place that is undisciplined, and in a place that is neither disciplined nor undisciplined, there is no indication of the body, and the original indication is lost, but one obtains non-indication. This is called non-indication but not indication.
What is indication and non-indication?
Answer:
If one is born in the desire realm in a place with precepts, there is indication of the body, and one obtains non-indication, and the original indication is not lost, and one obtains non-indication;

Neither disciplined nor undisciplined, neither good nor bad bodily intimation, one obtains non-intimation, and the original intimation is not lost, one obtains non-intimation. This is called intimation and non-intimation.
What is non-intimation and non-intimation?
Answer:

Ordinary people in the mother's womb or egg gradually thicken the membranes. If born in the desire realm, in a disciplined state, with bad bodily non-intimation, the original intimation is lost, and one does not obtain non-intimation;
In a neither disciplined nor undisciplined state, with bad bodily non-intimation, the original intimation is lost, and one does not obtain non-intimation;
If born in the form or formless realms, this is called non-intimation and non-intimation.
If one possesses present concealed indeterminate bodily intimation, does one possess non-intimation?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses non-intimation.
Can one possess intimation?
Answer:
Yes, one born in the form realm with concealed indeterminate bodily intimation.
If one possesses present non-obscured-neutral bodily action, does one possess non-information?
Answer:
There is no one who possesses non-information.
Can one possess information?
Answer:
Yes, one born in the desire realm, or one born in the form realm with present non-obscured-neutral bodily information.
Verbal action is also like this.
All actions in the desire realm, are those actions results of the desire realm?
Answer:
It is so, all actions in the desire realm are results of the desire realm.
Can there be actions that are results of the desire realm, but those actions are not of the desire realm?
Answer:
Yes, such as the desire realm emanations and speech created by the path of the form realm.
All actions in the form realm, are those actions results of the form realm?
Answer:
It is so, all actions that are results of the form realm are of the form realm.
Can there be actions that are of the form realm, but those actions are not results of the form realm?
Answer:
Yes, like the path of the form realm manifesting form realm emanations and making form realm speech, like the path of the form realm severing bonds and progressing towards realization.
Are all actions of the formless realm the fruits of actions of the formless realm?
Answer:
Thus, all actions of the formless realm are the fruits of actions of the formless realm.
Are there any actions of the formless realm that are not the fruits of actions of the formless realm?
Answer:
Yes, like the path of the formless realm severing bonds and progressing towards realization.
Are all actions without outflows the fruits of actions without outflows?
Answer:
Thus, all actions without outflows are the fruits of actions without outflows.
Are there any fruits of actions without outflows that are not actions without outflows?
Answer:
Yes, like the path of the form realm and formless realm severing bonds and progressing towards realization.
Are all actions not of the desire realm the fruits of actions not of the desire realm?
Answer:
Thus, all actions not of the desire realm are not the fruits of actions not of the desire realm.
Are there any actions that are not of the desire realm, but whose results are not not of the desire realm?
Answer:
Yes, such as the desire realm emanations and speech created by the path of the form realm.
Are there any actions that are not of the form realm, but whose results are not not of the form realm?
Answer:
Yes, such as the form realm emanations and speech created by the path of the desire realm.
Are there any actions that are not of the form realm, but whose results are not not of the form realm?
Answer:
Yes, such as the form realm path that eliminates the bonds and leads to realization.
Are there any actions that are not of the formless realm, but whose results are not not of the formless realm?
Answer:ğŸ”½Yes, such as the formless realm path that eliminates the bonds and leads to realization.
Are there any actions that are not of the formless realm, but whose results are not not of the formless realm?
Answer:
Yes, such as the formless realm path that eliminates the bonds and leads to realization.
Are all formations not pure, and are those formations not the fruits of pure dharmas?
Answer:
Thus, all formations that are not the fruits of pure dharmas are not pure.
Are there any formations that are not pure, and are those formations not the fruits of impure dharmas?
Answer:
There are, such as the path of the form and formless realms that severs bonds and realizes [nirvana].
Are there any impure formations that have impure fruits?
Answer:
There are, namely the supported fruit and the retributive fruit.
Are there any impure formations that have pure fruits?
Answer:
There are, namely the fruit of liberation.
Are there any impure formations that have both impure and pure fruits?
Answer:
There are, namely the supported fruit, the retributive fruit, and the fruit of liberation. [Impure formations are finished.]
Are there any pure formations that have pure fruits?
Answer:
There are, namely the supported fruit and the fruit of liberation.
Are there any pure formations that have impure fruits?
Answer:
There are none.
Can there be contaminated and uncontaminated fruits of uncontaminated actions?ğŸ”½
Are there any contaminated or uncontaminated actions that have contaminated or uncontaminated fruits?ğŸ”½Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Are there any contaminated actions that have contaminated or uncontaminated fruits?ğŸ”½Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Are there any contaminated or uncontaminated actions that have contaminated fruits?ğŸ”½Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Are there any contaminated or uncontaminated actions that have uncontaminated fruits?
Answer:
Yes, the fruit of liberation is contaminated or uncontaminated.
Are there any actions of the learner that are fruits of the learner?
Answer:
Yes, the supported fruit.
Are there any actions of the learner that are fruits of the post-learner?
Answer:
Yes, the supported fruit.
Are there any actions of the learner that are fruits of neither the learner nor the post-learner?
Answer:
Yes, the fruit of liberation.
Are there any actions of the post-learner that are fruits of the post-learner?
Answer:
Yes, the supported fruit.
Are there any actions of the post-learner that are fruits of the learner?ğŸ”½Answer:
No.ğŸ”½ğŸ”½
Are there any actions of the post-learner that are fruits of neither the learner nor the post-learner?
Answer:
There is, when the fruit of liberation is completely without outflows.
Can there be a non-learner and non-non-learner practice with a non-learner and non-non-learner fruit?
Answer:
There is, the supported fruit, the retribution fruit, and the fruit of liberation.
Can there be a non-learner and non-non-learner practice with a learner fruit?
Answer:
There is not.
Can there be a non-learner and non-non-learner practice with a non-learner fruit?
Answer:
There is not.
Moreover, the World-Honored One said:
Not cultivating the body, not cultivating precepts, not cultivating the mind, not cultivating wisdom.
How does one not cultivate the body?
Answer:
When desire for the body is not yet exhausted, greed is not yet exhausted, recollection is not yet exhausted, thirst is not yet exhausted.
Furthermore, with the unobstructed path exhausting desire for form, that path is not cultivated or relied upon.
Not cultivating the body in this way, not cultivating precepts is also like this.
How does one not cultivate the mind?
Answer:
The mind has not yet exhausted desire, has not yet exhausted craving, has not yet exhausted thought, has not yet exhausted thirst.
Furthermore, by the unobstructed path, one exhausts desire for the formless realm, that path is neither cultivated nor relied upon.
The mind that is not cultivated in this way, the wisdom that is not cultivated is also like this.
If one does not cultivate the body, does one not cultivate precepts?
Answer:
It is like this.
If one does not cultivate precepts, does one not cultivate the body?
Answer:
It is like this.
If one does not cultivate the body, does one not cultivate the mind?
Answer:
It is like this. If one does not cultivate the body, one does not cultivate the mind.
Is there a case of not cultivating the mind but not not cultivating the body?
Answer:
There is. When desire for form is exhausted but desire for the higher realms has not yet been exhausted.
If one does not cultivate the body, does one not cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
It is like this. If one does not cultivate the body, one does not cultivate wisdom.
Is there a case of not cultivating wisdom but not not cultivating the body?
Answer:
There is. When desire for form is exhausted but desire for the higher realms has not yet been exhausted.
If one does not cultivate precepts, do they not cultivate the mind?
Answer:
It is so, if one does not cultivate precepts, they do not cultivate the mind.
Can one not cultivate the mind but not not cultivate precepts?
Answer:
There is, when desire for form is ended but desire for the higher is not yet ended.
If one does not cultivate precepts, do they not cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
It is so, if one does not cultivate precepts, they do not cultivate wisdom.
Can one not cultivate wisdom but not not cultivate precepts?
Answer:
There is, when desire for form is ended but desire for the higher is not yet ended.
If one does not cultivate the mind, do they not cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
It is so.
If one does not cultivate wisdom, do they not cultivate the mind?
Answer:
It is so.
Moreover, the World-Honored One said:
Cultivating the body, cultivating precepts, cultivating the mind, cultivating wisdom.
What is cultivating the body?
Answer:
Ending desire for the body, ending greed, ending thoughts, ending thirst.
Furthermore, by the unobstructed path exhausting desire for form, that path cultivates equanimity.
Cultivating the body is like this, and so is cultivating precepts.
How does one cultivate the mind?
Answer:
The mind exhausts desire, exhausts craving, exhausts mindfulness, and exhausts thirst.
Furthermore, by the unobstructed path exhausting desire for the formless, that path cultivates equanimity.
Cultivating the mind is like this, and so is cultivating wisdom.
If one cultivates the body, does one also cultivate precepts?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
If one cultivates precepts, does one also cultivate the body?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
If one cultivates the body, does one also cultivate the mind?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
If one cultivates the mind, does one also cultivate the body?
Is it possible to cultivate the body without cultivating the mind?
Answer:
Yes, when desire for form is exhausted but desire for the higher realms is not yet exhausted.
If one cultivates the body, does one also cultivate wisdom?ğŸ”½Answer:
Yes.
If one cultivates wisdom, does one also cultivate the body?
Can one cultivate body but not cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
There is, when the craving for form is exhausted but the craving above it is not yet exhausted.
If one cultivates precepts, does one also cultivate mind?
Answer:
It is so.
If one cultivates mind, does one also cultivate precepts?
Can one cultivate precepts without cultivating mind?
Answer:
There is, when the craving for form is exhausted but the craving above it is not yet exhausted.
If one cultivates precepts, does one also cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
It is so.
If one cultivates wisdom, does one also cultivate precepts? Can one cultivate precepts without cultivating wisdom?
Answer:
There is, when the craving for form is exhausted but the craving above it is not yet exhausted.
If one cultivates mind, does one also cultivate wisdom?
Answer:
It is so.
If one cultivates wisdom, does one also cultivate mind?
Answer:
It is so.
Can one possess past precepts but not future or present ones of this kind?
Answer:
There is, when the taught precepts are exhausted but not lost, and those of this kind are not present.
And in the future, but not in the present - is this the case?
Answer:
There is. When the precepts of the path and concentration are exhausted, they are not lost, but this type does not appear in the present.
And in the present, but not in the future - is this the case?
Answer:
There is. When the precepts of instruction are exhausted, they are not lost, and this type appears in the present.
And in the future and present - is this the case?
Answer:
There is. When the precepts of the path and concentration are exhausted, they are not lost, and this type appears in the present - past is finished.
Can one possess future precepts, but not past or present - is this the case?
Answer:
There is. When an arhat is born in the formless realm.
And past, but not present - is this the case?
Answer:
There is. When the precepts of the path and concentration are exhausted, they are not lost, but this type does not appear in the present.
And present, but not past - is this the case?
Answer:
There is. When one first obtains the undefiled precepts.
And past and present of this type?
Answer:
There is. When the precepts of the path and concentration are not lost, this type is present and future.
Can one possess present precepts, but not past or future of this type?
Answer:
There is. When one first obtains the precepts of discipline.
And past, but not future of this type?
Answer:
There is. When the precepts are not lost, this type is present.
And future, but not past of this type?
Answer:
There is. When one first obtains the precepts of the undefiled.
And past and future of this type?
Answer:
There is. When the precepts of the path and concentration are not lost, this type is present.
The fourth chapter on teaching and non-teaching in the Abhidharma is complete. The Sanskrit has 373 Å›lokas, the Qin has 4,954 words.
5. Chapter on Self-Practice in the Abhidharma Practice Section, Part 5. What is self-practice?
For what reasons is there self-practice?
The practice that can be used for self-practice, should that practice be said to be past, future, or present?
The practice that can be used for self-practice, is that practice accomplished?
If the practice is accomplished, is that practice self-practice?ğŸ”½The practice that can be used but is not self-practice, is that practice unaccomplished?
If the practice is unaccomplished, is that practice not self-practice?ğŸ”½The practice that can be used for self-practice, does that practice necessarily receive retribution?
If the practice necessarily receives retribution, is that practice self-practice?
The practice that can be used but is not self-practice, does that practice necessarily not receive retribution?
If the practice necessarily does not receive retribution, is that practice not self-practice?ğŸ”½The practice that can be used and is accomplished, does that practice necessarily receive retribution?
If the practice necessarily receives retribution, is that practice accomplished?
Are the actions that are not accomplished necessarily not to be experienced?
If the actions are necessarily not to be experienced, are those actions not accomplished?
If there are non-virtuous actions of a stream-enterer whose painful results have not yet matured, what prevents them from going to the hells, animal realm, or hungry ghost realm?
Moreover, the World-Honored One said:
This is called a disciple of the World-Honored One who has exhausted the hells, exhausted the animal realm, exhausted the hungry ghost realm, and does not fall into the evil paths.

Does a stream-enterer have this knowledge, realizing that they have exhausted the hells, exhausted the animal realm, exhausted the hungry ghost realm, and exhausted not falling into the evil paths, or do they not realize it themselves?
What is it to plan harm?
Are all those who plan harm results?
What is it to prolong one's life? What is it to abandon one's life?
What is mental confusion?
What dharmas are associated with the fetters that are all unwholesome?
What is the Buddha's word?
Should it be said to be wholesome or indeterminate?
What dharmas are called the Buddha's word?
What are the names of sutra, verse, record, verse-tale, cause-and-condition, praise, origin-and-end, parable, birth-story, extensive discourse, unprecedented event, and doctrinal meaning?
What is the name of seal?ğŸ”½What is the name of counting?
What is the name of calculation?ğŸ”½What is the name of writing?
What is the name of verse?
What is the name of various skills?ğŸ”½If one has accomplished the training in precepts, does one also accomplish the precepts that are neither training nor post-training?

If one has accomplished the precepts that are neither training nor post-training, does one also accomplish the training in precepts?ğŸ”½If one has accomplished the post-training precepts, does one also accomplish the precepts that are neither training nor post-training?
If one has accomplished the precepts that are neither training nor post-training, does one also accomplish the post-training precepts?
Please explain the meaning of this chapter in full.
What is self-practice?
Answer:
If the practice is retribution, it is called attained in the present. This is the practice that gives rise to and receives retribution in this life, which is called self-practice.
By what kind of self-practice?
Answer:
This action is its own fruit, its own basis, and its own retribution;
Furthermore, when this action receives retribution, this mind receives retribution, not others. For this reason, it is self-action.
The action that is used as self-action, should this action be said to be past, future, or present?
Answer:
That action is in the past.
The action that is used as self-action, is that action accomplished?
Answer:
There may be action that is self-action, but that action is not accomplished.
How is it that action is self-action, but that action is not accomplished?
Answer:

If the retribution for the action is obtained now, that action arises and receives retribution, but that action is lost. This is called action that is self-action, but that action is not accomplished.
How is it that action is accomplished, but that action is not self-action?
Answer:

If the retribution for the action is not obtained now, that action arises but does not receive retribution, and that action is not lost. This is called action that is accomplished, but that action is not self-action.
What is meant by 'the action is one's own, and the action is accomplished'?
Answer:
If the retribution of the action is obtained in this life, and the action produces retribution, and the action is not lost, this is called 'the action is one's own, and the action is accomplished'.
What is meant by 'the action is not one's own, and the action is not accomplished'?
Answer:

If the retribution of the action is not obtained in this life, and the action does not produce retribution, and the action is lost, this is called 'the action is not one's own, and the action is not accomplished'.
The opposite is also like this.
Is the action that can be one's own necessarily one that will definitely receive retribution?
Answer:
There may be an action that is one's own but does not necessarily receive retribution.
What is meant by 'the action is one's own but does not necessarily receive retribution'?
Answer:

If the retribution of the action is obtained in this life, and the action produces retribution, and the action is a future retribution, this is called 'the action is one's own but does not necessarily receive retribution'.
What is meant by 'the action necessarily receives retribution but is not one's own'?
Answer:

If the result of the action is not to be experienced in this life, and the action has arisen but the result has not yet matured, this is an action whose result is to be experienced, but it is not an action that is being experienced.
What is an action that is being experienced and whose result is to be experienced?
Answer:

If the result of the action is to be experienced in this life, and the action has arisen and is being experienced, but it is not a subsequent result, this is an action that is being experienced and whose result is to be experienced.
What is an action that is not being experienced and whose result is not to be experienced?
Answer:

If the result of the action is not to be experienced in this life, and the action has arisen but is not being experienced, and the result has matured, this is an action that is not being experienced and whose result is not to be experienced.
The opposite is also like this.
If an action is accomplished, must that action necessarily have a result?
Answer:
There may be an action that is accomplished but does not necessarily have a result.
What is an action that is accomplished but does not necessarily have a result?
Answer:
If the past unwholesome or wholesome contaminated actions have already ripened, those actions are not lost;

If the future unwholesome or wholesome contaminated actions are obtained but will not arise, or if the indeterminate or uncontaminated actions are accomplished, these are called actions that are accomplished but their results will not necessarily be experienced.
What are the actions that will necessarily have results but are not accomplished?
Answer:
If the past unwholesome or wholesome contaminated actions have not yet ripened, those actions are lost;
If the future unwholesome or wholesome contaminated actions are not obtained but will arise, these are called actions that will necessarily have results but are not accomplished.
What are the actions that are accomplished and their results will necessarily be experienced?
Answer:ğŸ”½If the past unwholesome or wholesome contaminated actions have not yet ripened, those actions are not lost;
If the future unwholesome or wholesome contaminated actions are obtained and will arise;
All present unwholesome and wholesome contaminated actions are called actions that are accomplished and their fruits must be experienced.
What are actions that are not accomplished and their fruits must not be experienced?
Answer:
All past unwholesome and wholesome contaminated actions whose fruits have matured and have been lost;
All future unwholesome and wholesome contaminated actions that are not necessarily attained and will not arise;
And all neutral and uncontaminated actions that are not accomplished. These are called actions that are not accomplished and their fruits must not be experienced.
The opposite is also like this.
If there is a stream-enterer whose unwholesome actions and painful fruits have not yet matured, by what means does he obstruct the paths of hell, animals, and hungry ghosts?
Answer:
The two kinds of bonds and fetters necessarily lead to hell, animals, and hungry ghosts:
The bonds and fetters to be eliminated by seeing the truths, and the bonds and fetters to be eliminated by contemplation.

Those stream-enterers have exhausted the bonds to be eliminated by seeing the truths, but have not yet eliminated those to be eliminated by contemplation. They are incomplete, and do not go to the hells, animal realms, or hungry ghost realms.
It is like a cart with two wheels that are not broken can go somewhere, but with one wheel broken it cannot go anywhere.
In the same way, the two kinds of bonds bind and lead to the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms:
The bonds to be eliminated by seeing the truths and the bonds to be eliminated by contemplation.

Those stream-enterers have exhausted the bonds to be eliminated by seeing the truths, but have not yet eliminated the bonds to be eliminated by contemplation. They are incomplete, and do not go to fall into the hells, animal realms, or hungry ghost realms.
It is like a hawk with two wings that are not broken can fly to the sky, but with one wing broken it cannot reach the sky.

In the same way, the two kinds of bonds bind and lead to falling into the hells, animal realms, and hungry ghost realms. Those stream-enterers have exhausted the bonds to be eliminated by seeing the truths, but have not yet eliminated the bonds to be eliminated by contemplation. They are incomplete, and do not go to the hells, animal realms, or hungry ghost realms.
Moreover, the World-Honored One said:
This is called the disciple of the World-Honored One who has ended hell, ended animal births, ended the hungry ghost realm, and ended falling into bad destinies.

Does the stream-enterer have this knowledge, realizing that he has ended hell, ended animal births, ended the hungry ghost realm, and ended falling into bad destinies, or does he not realize it himself?
Answer:
He does not realize it himself.
How is this known?
Answer:
He goes for refuge to the World-Honored One.
As the World-Honored One said:
Those who reflect on the four dharmas should diligently progress themselves, ending hell, ending animal births, ending the hungry ghost realm, and ending falling into bad destinies.
Furthermore, the stream-enterer has four dharma knowledges:

the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of the accumulation [of suffering], the knowledge of cessation, and the knowledge of the path. The stream-enterer does not have the knowledge of ending or the knowledge of non-arising.
What is called harming oneself in training?
Answer:

For example, if one is learning and has not yet exhausted desire, and is beaten by others with hands, stones, knives, or sticks, the pain causes one to give rise to the thought of making them suffer greatly and making their wife childless. In this way, one learns to harm.

For example, if one is learning and has exhausted desire, and is beaten by them with hands, stones, knives, or sticks, the pain causes one to regress from desirelessness, and upon regression, one gives rise to the thought,
Make them suffer greatly and make their wife childless.
In this way, one learns to harm.
Is the result of all learning harmful?
Answer:
No, for beings with great power, their actions do not bear fruit.
How does one prolong one's life?
Answer:
For example, if an arhat gives robes, alms bowl, key, sandals, needle case, and other necessities to the Saá¹…gha, he then gives rise to the thought,
May this cause my lifespan to be extended.
Having made this vow, he enters the fourth dhyÄna of the peak, and the retribution he has caused becomes the retribution for lifespan. In this way, one prolongs one's life.
How does one abandon one's life?
Answer:
It is like an arhat who gives his robes, alms bowl, key, sandals, needle and thread case, and other belongings to the Saá¹…gha or individuals, and then gives rise to the thought:
The karmic retribution I have obtained for my lifespan will now be transformed into the karmic retribution for giving.

Having made this vow, he enters the fourth dhyÄna of the peak of existence, and the karmic retribution for his lifespan is transformed into the karmic retribution for giving. In this way, he abandons his life.
How does one become mentally disturbed?
Answer:
One becomes mentally disturbed due to four things.
Seeing non-human forms such as mad elephants, horses, rams, and bulls, one becomes frightened and mentally disturbed;
If non-humans become angry and beat one's limbs and joints, one experiences severe pain and becomes mentally disturbed;
Or the great elements become disordered and one becomes mentally disturbed;
Or one becomes mentally disturbed due to the karmic retribution of past actions.
With what fetters are the dharmas associated with unwholesomeness?
Answer:
Shamelessness and lack of conscience.
What is the Buddha's speech?
Answer:
The teachings in the ten regions of India are all speech, this is called the Buddha's speech.
Should the Buddha's words be said to be wholesome or indeterminate?
He replied:
The Buddha's words may be wholesome or indeterminate.
How are they wholesome?
He replied:
Wholesome thoughts, the TathÄgata's words, and what is said above are the ten wholesome [things].
How are they indeterminate?
He replied:
Indeterminate thoughts, the TathÄgata's words, and what is said above are the ten indeterminate [things].
What dharmas are called the Buddha's words?
He replied:
The body of names, the body of phrases, and the body of words abide in sequence.
The answer is:
The body of names, the body of phrases, and the body of words abide in sequence.
What is the dharma called a seal?
He replied:
Bodily action skillfully created and the wisdom attained from it.
What is the dharma called counting?
He replied:
Verbal action skillfully created and the wisdom attained from it.
What is the dharma called calculation?
He replied:
Mental action skillfully created and the wisdom attained from it.
What is the dharma called writing?
The wisdom attained through skillful bodily actions.
What is the meaning of the term prajÃ±Ä?
The answer is:
The wisdom attained through skillful verbal actions.
What is the meaning of the term various attainments?
The answer is:
The various wisdoms attained through the foremost wisdom and skillful means.
If one has accomplished the precepts of training, does one also accomplish the precepts that are neither training nor post-training?
The answer is:
One may have accomplished the precepts of training but not the precepts that are neither training nor post-training.
What is meant by having accomplished the precepts of training but not the precepts that are neither training nor post-training?
The answer is:
Those in the training stage who are born in the formless realm - this is meant by having accomplished the precepts of training but not the precepts that are neither training nor post-training.
What is meant by having accomplished the precepts that are neither training nor post-training but not the precepts of training?
The answer is:
Arhats and ordinary beings born in the desire and form realms - this is meant by having accomplished the precepts that are neither training nor post-training but not the precepts of training.
What is meant by having accomplished the precepts of training and the precepts that are neither training nor post-training?
Answer:
Those who study and are born in the desire or form realms possess the precepts of training but not those of neither training nor post-training.
What about those who do not possess the precepts of training and not those of neither training nor post-training?
Answer:
Arhats and ordinary people born in the formless realm possess the precepts of neither training nor post-training but not those of training.
If one possesses the precepts of post-training, do they also possess the precepts of neither training nor post-training?
Answer:
There are those who possess the precepts of post-training but not those of neither training nor post-training.
What about those who possess the precepts of post-training but not those of neither training nor post-training?
Answer:
Arhats born in the formless realm possess the precepts of post-training but not those of neither training nor post-training.
What about those who possess the precepts of neither training nor post-training but not those of post-training?
Answer:
Those in training and ordinary people born in the desire or form realms possess the precepts of neither training nor post-training but not those of post-training.
How does one possess non-learner precepts but not learner or non-learner precepts?
The answer is:
Arhats born in the desire or form realms possess non-learner precepts but not learner or non-learner precepts.
How does one not possess non-learner precepts but not non-learner precepts?
The answer is:
Learners and ordinary beings born in the formless realm do not possess non-learner precepts but not non-learner precepts.
